data.title: Shift+Drag file outside from tree open it in new window
data.body:
An expected behaviour for multi screen users

1 Press shift
2 Click and hold on file in explorer tree
3 Drag outside VSCode
4 Release click

=> Open a new window with the selected file within

Make VSCode better than Wbstrm !

data.title: Continue refactoring html content renderer
data.body:
* Splits `renderHtml` into three distict functions to prevent passing in mixed content types
* Moves the `inline` and `className` properties onto the `RenderOptions` structure

data.title: [loc][query][VSCode]  It seems that this sentence is not finished
data.body:
According to Transifex issue tracker for string 173
https://www.transifex.com/microsoft-oss/vscode-workbench/translate/#zh-Hans/$/111041244?q=Key or key sequence
It seems that this sentence is not finished because missing right parenthesis. Or it will combine with another string. Please clarify which one if this is the case.

**Context:**
src/vs/workbench/services/keybinding/electron-browser/keybindingService:English (en):plaintext:vscode.extension.contributes.keybindings.key
**Resource:**
vs_workbench_services_keybinding
**String Text:**
Key or key sequence (separate keys with plus-sign and sequences with space, e.g Ctrl+O and Ctrl+L L for a chord

data.title: [loc][query][VSCode] "text mate" -> "TextMate"
data.body:
In Transifex, community member - EbXpJ6bp suggested "text mate" -> "TextMate". Please take a look if need to change in source string.
https://www.transifex.com/microsoft-oss/vscode-workbench/translate/#ja/$/111166756?q=text mate

**Context:**
src/vs/workbench/services/themes/electron-browser/colorThemeData:English (en):plaintext:error.invalidformat.tokenColors
**Resource:**
vs_workbench_services_themes
**String text:**
Problem parsing color theme file: {0}. Property 'tokenColors' should be either an array specifying colors or a path to a 

> _text mate_ 

theme file

data.title: Fix TS 2.4 Compile Errors in taskConfiguration.ts
data.body:
```
[15:15:13] Error: /Users/matb/projects/vscode/src/vs/workbench/parts/tasks/common/taskConfiguration.ts(697,8): Type '({ property: "type"; } | { property: "name"; } | { property: "options"; type: typeof CommandOptio...' is not assignable to type 'MetaData<CommandConfiguration, CommandOptions | PresentationOptions>[]'.
  Type '{ property: "type"; } | { property: "name"; } | { property: "options"; type: typeof CommandOption...' is not assignable to type 'MetaData<CommandConfiguration, CommandOptions | PresentationOptions>'.
    Type '{ property: "presentation"; type: typeof PresentationOptions; }' is not assignable to type 'MetaData<CommandConfiguration, CommandOptions | PresentationOptions>'.
      Types of property 'type' are incompatible.
        Type 'typeof PresentationOptions' is not assignable to type 'ParserType<CommandOptions | PresentationOptions>'.
          Types of property 'isEmpty' are incompatible.
            Type '(this: void, value: PresentationOptions) => boolean' is not assignable to type '(value: CommandOptions | PresentationOptions) => boolean'.
              Types of parameters 'value' and 'value' are incompatible.
                Type 'CommandOptions | PresentationOptions' is not assignable to type 'PresentationOptions'.
                  Type 'CommandOptions' is not assignable to type 'PresentationOptions'.
                    Property 'reveal' is missing in type 'CommandOptions'.
```

**To Investigate**
1. Open `taskConfiguration.ts`. 
2. Make sure that typescript 2.4-insiders is active in the workspace

data.title: Fix more Compiler Errors for TS 2.4 in the VSCode codebase
Devdependencies of built-in extension get pulled into user's machine when installing VS Code
data.body:
@joaomoreno @alexandrudima  I am seeing a pattern where devdependencies of built in extensions are getting pulled into the installed VS Code.

Example:
- `git` extension has a dev dependency on `mocha`. https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/release/1.13/extensions/git/package.json#L642
- Now look at `C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\extensions\git` (or the corresponding folder in Mac/linux)
- you will see mocha there.

data.title: "window.enableMenuBarMnemonics":false not working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:18:03.540Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-78-generic

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|jupyter|donjayamanne|1.1.3|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.5|
|vscode-emacs|hiro-sun|0.1.1|;

My settings.json looks like this, and I still have the problem. Visual Studio Code v.1.13.1. Ubuntu 16.04.

{
    "python.pythonPath": "${workspaceRoot}/venv/bin/python3",
    "window.enableMenuBarMnemonics":false
}

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Press alt-v. It opens the file menu, and doesn't move the cursor.

data.title: editor.mouseWheelScrollSensitivity has no effect
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:18:03.540Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.11.0+
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.15.2|
|vscode-rust|kalitaalexey|0.3.14|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Change `editor.mouseWheelScrollSensitivity` to something extreme, like 20
2. Restart vscode (just to make sure the setting is applied)
3. Turn the scroll wheel

Expected behavior:

It should scroll by much more than it used to.

Actual behavior:

Scrolling didn't change compared to the default settings.

data.title: Customize indent rules in language configuration
data.body: Similar to what we do for wordSeparators, allow extensions to define indentation rules in language configuration file.

data.title: Output of code-cli.bat script not shown
data.body:
I'm trying to use the `--verbose` option with Code - OSS Dev (which as of writing is up to date with the master branch) on Windows 10. However, nothing is printed to the terminal when running `scripts\code-cli.bat --verbose`.

The same behavior also occurs with `scripts\code-cli.bat --help`. However this does not launch a new VS Code window, so it seems as if the command line arguments are being passed correctly, but the help does not get printed.

data.title: Makefile syntax highlight bug, caused by comments
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.5

Steps to Reproduce:
In this Makefile snippet, the variable "HCC_LIB_OBJ" in the second line is not properly colored, due to comment at the end of the first line. If the comment is removed, "HCC_LIB_OBJ" is colored correctly. But "HCC_LIB_OBJ"'s colorization should not be affected by whether there is a comment in the preceding line.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18319900/27304027-9710dc4c-54f1-11e7-9c3c-2663082053d7.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18319900/27304114-eb8e13de-54f1-11e7-9ab7-4bc554a780b0.png)

data.title: This issue is assigned a wrong label by vscodebot. Please delete it.
How to completely remove extensions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:13:05.928Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.1.1|
|vscode-eclipse-keybindings|alphabotsec|0.9.5|
|jshint|dbaeumer|0.10.15|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.11|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.5|
|vscode-JS-CSS-HTML-formatter|lonefy|0.2.3|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.62|
|MagicPython|magicstack|1.0.10|
|prettify-json|mohsen1|0.0.3|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.11.4|
|python|tht13|0.2.3|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. install vscode with homebrew cask install;
2. install some extensions;
3. remove vscode with homebrew cask uninstall;
4. install vscode with homebrew cask install again;
5. the extensions remained;

That means on removing vscode, the extensions (zombies) were not cleared. How can I completely remove them?

data.title: icon pollution - how can I restore default icon for my json file after removing vscode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:13:05.928Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.1.1|
|vscode-eclipse-keybindings|alphabotsec|0.9.5|
|jshint|dbaeumer|0.10.15|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.11|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.5|
|vscode-JS-CSS-HTML-formatter|lonefy|0.2.3|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.62|
|MagicPython|magicstack|1.0.10|
|prettify-json|mohsen1|0.0.3|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.11.4|
|python|tht13|0.2.3|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install vscode with `brew cask install visual-studio-code`;
2. All json icons became vscode's ugly butterfly like icon;
3. remove vscode by `brew cask remove visual-studio-code`;
4. the json file icon remain unchanged, still the ugly butterfly like icon;
4. I know Microsoft has the tradition of polluting user's computer by leaving their zombie stuff uncleaned. What I didn't expect is now their habit is invading my Mac.

data.title: Feature Request: FTP Watcher
data.body: Could you add a native FTP Watcher to VS Code? The extensions I tried don't work reliably and I love VS Code so far so having a file watcher that automatically uploads file changes to an ftp server would be awesome.

data.body: Upstream issue: https://github.com/sourcelair/xterm.js/issues/718

data.title: Feature: Add toggle to "Quick file open" to search excluded files
data.body:
There are times that I want to open files that are excluded by the "files.excluded" or "search.excluded" settings.

Use cases:
* Open a file inside `node_modules`
* Open a JS file created by the TypeScript compiler

In WebStorm, the quick search has a toggle to search excluded files also.  The first time you use the shortcut to open it, it only searches included files.  Hitting the shortcut again while the dialog is open toggles the search all option.

data.title: VSCode should have option to hide bottom output panel when typing in editor area
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1 (379d2efb5539b09112c793d3d9a413017d736f89, 2017-06-14T18:13:05.928Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|output-colorizer|IBM|0.1.1|
|material-icon-theme|PKief|2.0.9|
|numbered-bookmarks|alefragnani|0.10.0|
|workbench|andrew-lis|0.1.6|
|pgsql|doublefint|0.0.8|
|golang-tdd|joaoacdias|0.0.9|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.62|
|railscasts|mrded|0.0.4|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.10.0|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.9.0|
|vscode-apielements|vncz|0.6.6|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type in the editor area.
2. The bottom output area should autohide when typing in the editor and autoshow when we run or debug.

This would free up valuable screen real estate for editing, especially on a laptop.
